predicate.note: Frames file for 'warm' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: agentive
example.text: John warmed his buns in the toaster.

example.name: is it getting warm in here?
example.text: William Lynes, a retired engineer from Lockheed Corp., says he and his wife, Lily, warmed to the investment pitches of a penny-stock peddler from Stuart-James Co. in Atlanta after the broker told them he, too, had once worked with Lockheed.
example.arg: the investment pitches of a penny-stock peddler from Stuart-James Co. in Atlanta
after the broker told them he, too, had once worked with Lockheed.

example.name: ergative
example.text: Try as he might, John just couldn't warm up after coming in from the storm.
example.arg: after coming in from the storm.

example.name: adjectival
example.text: ``The branches are just warmed over, empty halls,'' says Mr. Konheim.
